summary: The document is a classified communication from 1996, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details an unsolicited fax received by the Denver NVTAG office from Robert Plumlee, also known as William H. Pearson, who claims a former association with NWBOLTON. Plumlee discusses his involvement in sabotaging a Denver magazine article related to the Kennedy assassination to avoid government scrutiny of his past activities. He mentions his classified testimony to the Senate and Congress, suggesting its future declassification, and expresses reluctance to assist further due to concerns over his credibility.
key_findings: Robert Plumlee, also known as William H. Pearson, sent an unsolicited fax to the Denver NVTAG office discussing his past actions and associations.
Plumlee admitted to sabotaging a magazine article on the Kennedy assassination to evade government scrutiny.
He referenced classified testimony provided to the Senate and Congress, indicating it might be declassified in the future.
The document hints at complex associations involving NWBOLTON, the Cuban Desk, and potentially the Kennedy assassination.
Plumlee expressed a desire to distance himself from further investigations, citing his actions as undermining his credibility.
